message: As the 115th Congress begins, we must resist Republican attempts to repeal the progress we have made for so many Americans, including the Affordable Care Act and financial regulations that protect working families. I strongly condemn any actions that would undo the legislation we passed for constituents in the 11th Congressional District and Americans across the country.

The next SEC Chair needs to preserve the protections we have in place to protect working families. Since 2008, our economy has shown tremendous progress. As one of the authors of the Dodd-Frank Act, we implemented regulations to prevent another financial crisis and to protect consumers. I hope the next administration will maintain these regulations and work for the interests of all Americans, not just a wealthy few. The President-elect's pick will have to set aside years as a Wall Street insider to promote and maintain well-regulated, transparent markets and investor protections.
Proud to stand with my Democratic colleagues to speak out about the importance of the Affordable Care Act for women's health.
In case you missed it, I joined Science Friday last week to discuss science in the 115th Congress. Check it out!

The science is clear and well documented - climate change is real. We cannot ignore the facts simply because it fits someone's political ideology. There is no such thing as politically correct science, only facts that require our immediate attention and action.

Today, I voted against the disastrous Republican budget proposal that would add $9.5 trillion to the national debt and end health insurance for 30 million people. This budget is an unfortunate example of politicians who care more about partisan games than the well-being of Americans.

On Wednesday, scientists reported that 2016 was the warmest year on record and that surface temperatures are heading toward levels that many scientists believe will pose a threat to both the natural world and to human civilization. This is yet more sobering data that confirms the reality of climate change.
I had a wonderful time with students this weekend the Neuqua Valley High School robotics tournament. Their work will pave the way for new innovations and technology in the future.

Today, I spoke out on the House Floor against a bill that would severely limit access to quality health care for women. Women are more than capable of making health care decisions with their doctor without interference from legislators.

I strongly condemn the building of a wall with Mexico and actions by the new administration to provoke fear within immigrant communities. We should be celebrating the innovation, culture, and diversity that immigrants from all walks of life bring to the United States. If President Trump wants to truly put America first, he will support immigrants and their families instead of demonizing them.

I find it very troubling that President Trump is silencing our scientific community – including ordering the EPA to remove scientifically valid references to climate change from their website.  This isn’t how democracy is supposed to work. Scientists in business, academia, and National Laboratories need the freedom to conduct scientific inquires without fear of persecution.
I am proud to receive an A from the National Education Association. All students deserve a chance to succeed regardless of where they live.
I strongly denounce President Trump's attempt to close our nation's doors to refugees seeking a better life in America.

I am deeply concerned about President Trump’s assault on the financial reforms enacted after the 2008 economic crisis. President Trump often refers to himself as a champion of working Americans, but decisions like this suggest his top priority is catering to Wall Street executives and the financial companies responsible for the worst economic crisis since the Great Depression.

Today, I was proud to join Senator Tammy Duckworth at the Islamic Center of Naperville to listen to members of our community share their concerns about President Trump's #MuslimBan and to discuss how we can work together to stand up for American values.

I joined my Democratic colleagues this morning to call on the Trump Administration to preserve the Dodd Frank Wall Street Reform Act to prevent another financial collapse. Millions lost their homes and retirement savings - we cannot let it happen again.
I stood with my colleagues today to recognize the importance of health care and the Affordable Care Act for children and their future.

Yesterday's court decision affirms what we all know - the executive order is a bigoted attempt to enact a Muslim ban. I am encouraged by the stability the judicial system has imposed on this Administration. The President’s dismissal of our judiciary is deeply concerning, and I will do anything necessary to maintain the constitutional separation of powers.

On Monday, I am hosting a community discussion at the Islamic Center of Naperville on the impact that President Trump’s actions to bar immigrants from Muslim-majority countries have had on our own Muslim community – and the fear that these orders have provoked. I hope you’ll join us for a productive conversation with prominent local leaders. Visit foster.house.gov/executiveorder for more information and to register to attend.

Thank you to everyone who came out to the Islamic Center of Naperville this morning for a discussion about how President Trump’s fear-mongering and anti-immigrant policies are impacting people right here in our community.

I’m grateful that so many students from throughout the 11th District took the time to make this Valentine’s Day a special one for local veterans. Our offices received more than 2,000 Valentines For Vets – an amazing number and a testament to the value our community places on taking care of those who have served us. Thank you to everyone who participated this year and made it possible.

During Black History Month, we reflect on the great impact African-Americans have made in our country’s history. Spring training is a perfect chance to look back on the legacy of Jackie Robinson, who 70 years ago, broke the color barrier in Major League Baseball and opened the door for generations of African-American athletes to pursue their dreams. Check out this great resource from the Library of Congress to learn more about Jackie’s impact on American history: go.usa.gov/cEnSd
I had a great time meeting with students from the Naperville North debate team this morning to discuss major policy issues in our country.

Please join us this Wednesday, February 22 for an important discussion on the heroin and opioid epidemic. We'll hear from some of our community's leaders to discuss local efforts to expand treatment and save lives. Details are below. Sign up here to join us: Foster.house.gov/heroin
Thank you to students at Bednarcik Junior High School for hosting a fascinating robotics tournament this weekend. They should be proud of their work and their commitment to enriching their education.

Please join us tomorrow when I host local leaders for a discussion on the status of the fight against heroin and prescription drug abuse in the 11th District. Please visit foster.house.gov/heroin for the details and to register to attend.

Recent price hikes in the cost of the life-saving naloxone product Evzio are very troubling. That’s why I led a letter with dozens of my colleagues to demand answers about why this drug is being priced beyond the reach of individuals who need it.
Thank you to everyone who came out this morning for our discussion on how communities here in the 11th District are fighting back against the heroin and opioid epidemic.
I'm proud to earn 100% on the League of Conservation Voters 2016 National Environmental Scorecard.

So proud to be joined by Samia Abdul-Qadir to represent the 11th Congressional District at tonight's Presidential Address to Congress. Samia - a junior at Naperville North High School - has been a bright spot of courage and conviction amidst an atmosphere too dominated by fear and hate.

It’s become clear that Attorney General Sessions lied under oath during his confirmation hearings about his communications with Russian officials during the presidential campaign. Attorney General Sessions has lost all credibility and is unfit to serve as our nation’s top law enforcement officer – he must resign immediately. We also need to have an independent commission investigate this Administration’s connections and communications with Russia.

President Trump’s new executive action is just more of the same fear-mongering we’ve witnessed from his first days in office. His executive actions do nothing to make America safer and are nothing more than a mechanism for state-sanctioned discrimination.
Very proud to earn a score of 100% from the Defenders of Wildlife for making wildlife and habitat conservation a priority.

For seven years, Republicans have promised to show us a health care plan that would lower costs and make health care better. But the plan we saw yesterday would cost millions of Americans their health insurance, ration health care for the poor and elderly, rapidly bankrupt Medicare, and offer massive new tax cuts to the wealthy.
I am proud to join my colleagues on International Women's Day to call for equal pay for equal work, affordable health care, and equality for all women around the world.
Today, I spoke out against the Republicans' health care plan that would cause millions of people to lose their health insurance.

Tomorrow is March 14, but more appropriately known as Pi Day. Please join me at my Aurora District Office to enjoy some good conversation, and of course, some great pie! Our Pi Day event is open to everyone, and will be held from 11:00 a.m. until noon at 2711 E. New York St. in Aurora.
Happy Pi Day! I had a great time speaking with constituents and enjoying some great pie at my Aurora District Office today.

Today, I’ve introduced a bipartisan resolution to designate March 14 as National Pi Day. This is about much more than just a fun excuse to eat pie – it’s about encouraging the next generation of students to pursue their interests in mathematics and other STEM subjects.

I strongly condemn President Trump’s budget which would inflict serious damage to our country. Not only would it eliminate vital funding for science and education – it would make it more difficult for hardworking Americans to make a better life for themselves and their children.

Check out my recent interview on NPR's Here & Now to discuss the Trump Administration’s disturbing lack of interest in science and plans to cut funding for scientific research and environmental protection.

It’s not too late to check out the great resources offered by the Library of Congress for Women’s History Month. These pieces offer a comprehensive look at some of the vital contributions women have made to American history.

We are pleased to announce this year’s Congressional Art Competition. It’s open to high school students from the 11th Congressional District. Submissions should be dropped off to my Aurora or Joliet offices no later than April 21, 2017. Please visit foster.house.gov/art for more details and instructions on how to submit your work!

Great news! The Catholic Charities of the Diocese of Joliet will receive over $2.3 million in grants to continue their  Head Start and Early Head Start programs. These vital programs lay the groundwork for educational success for children throughout Joliet.

Today, I was proud to be on the Floor of the U.S. House as pressure from across the political spectrum forced the Republican Party to pull the American Health Care Act, also known as TrumpCare, from consideration. If this legislation had passed, the result would have been a disaster for retirees, veterans, and hardworking Americans.

I strongly condemn President Trump’s decision to undo federal regulations that protect our environment. This reckless order shows a fundamental ignorance of climate science and its importance to our country’s future.
It was great visiting with students from Joliet's Hufford Junior High School during their visit to Washington D.C. this week.

Yesterday, I voted against an effort to repeal an Obama-era internet privacy rule that ensures you are notified of how internet service providers use your personal data. Americans should have the right to decide how their internet providers use their personal information.
Great to meet with Planned Parenthood on #PinkOut Day. They provide life saving care for women in Illinois and throughout the country.

The Trump Administration seems to think that ignoring climate change –  even banishing use of the phrase by government employees – will make the problem go away. But science doesn’t work like that. Denial won’t solve the problem, it will only make it worse.

It was an honor to help kick off the 2nd annual Cyber Defense Competition at Argonne National Laboratory this morning. Best of luck to all the students competing. (Though I have to admit being a bit partial to the team from Lewis University!)
Check out my op-ed today on why science matters. The vast majority of scientists believe that climate change is real, and it is time for us to act.
I joined my colleagues today to recognize Equal Pay Day. I support the Paycheck Fairness Act so that all women are fully compensated for their work.

I hope you’ll join me next Thursday evening to hear the latest about the debate over health care and the Affordable Care Act. We will hear from health care experts and people from right here in our district about the importance of protecting our care. For more details and to register for this event, visit foster.house.gov/aca.

Today, I spoke on the House Floor in support of the National Endowment for the Arts and National Endowment for the Humanities. These organizations provide vital funding for programs that connect us to our common past and help us understand places beyond our imaginations.

Attention high school students from the 11th Congressional District: If you’re interested in pursuing an education at one of America’s world-class service academies, join us on Saturday, April 15th in Aurora for Service Academy Day. Representatives from each of the academies will be on hand to provide information about their institutions, the application process, and answer any questions you may have. This event is free and parents are encouraged to attend as well. For all the details, visit foster.house.gov/service. See you there!

NASA’s climate science missions provide scientists with vital data they need to better understand how climate is changing and we should be investing in them. President Trump’s budget would pose a serious threat to them and the future of climate science research.
Great to be at the Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago today for the 2017 Financial Literacy Summit to discuss how we can best expand financial education and literacy in our communities.
Join us tonight for a community discussion on health care and the Affordable Care Act tonight in Naperville. Please check out foster.house.gov/aca for the details – hope to see you there!
Thank you to everyone who came to our forum on health care and the Affordable Care Act. It is heartening to see so many stand up for accessible and affordable health insurance for everyone.
High school students in the 11th District – you still have time to submit your artwork for the 2017 Congressional Art Competition. Deadline for submissions is this Friday!
Yesterday, I visited the historic Paramount Theater in Aurora to discuss the importance of programs like the National Endowment for the Arts and how cutting their funding would hurt our communities.

I'm excited to host a Climate Change Forum at North Central College on Saturday, May 6th. We'll be joined by experts on climate science, including WGN Chief Meteorologist Tom Skilling, for a discussion about how people can get involved in addressing the climate issues facing our nation and our world. This event is free and open to the public, but tickets are required. Please visit this link for more information and to reserve your seats!
Had a great time discussing government with Lincoln-Way West High School students on Wednesday. Thank you for the invitation!
This weekend, scientists and science advocates will join the March for Science in Washington and across the country. Here's why I will join them as a scientist and concerned citizen.
Rain can't stop us at the March for Science. Great to see so many scientists and science supporters today.
Thanks to everyone who came to the March for Science today. The turn out was fantastic in Washington and around the country.
Great to visit Senior Service Associates today to thank the volunteers who make our communities stronger with their service.
There are only a few tickets left for our upcoming Climate Change Forum featuring WGN Chief Meteorologist Tom Skilling. Follow this link to reserve your seats!

President Trump’s tax plan shows he intends to help the rich expand their bank accounts at the expense of hard-working Americans. The plan will also massively expand the national debt, and we simply can’t afford a repeat of the enormous deficits we saw the last time Republicans controlled all three branches of government.

Today, I spoke in support of our federal workers - many of whom are scientists - who work every day to advance our country's leadership in innovation. In his first 100 days, President Trump has threatened to cut the federal workforce and destroy research funding while stocking his cabinet and senior level positions with unqualified Wall Street executives. So if a swamp needs to be drained, let's start with Mar-A-Lago.
Tomorrow is National Prescription Drug Take Back Day. You can use this helpful link to locate a near-by collection site where you can safely and conveniently dispose of your unused medications.

Proud to stand with my colleagues on Immigrants' Rights Day to reaffirm our unwavering support for immigrants and their families. We are a nation of immigrants and are a stronger country because of it.

I am proud to stand with the LGBTQ community and cosponsor the Equality Act. No one should live in fear of being fired, losing their job, being bullied at school, or being turned away from a restaurant because of who they are or who they love. History stands on the side of equality and dignity.

After more than 28 hours in committee this week, I opposed a Republican plan which would dismantle the Wall Street reforms and consumer protections put in place after the Great Recession. #WrongChoiceAct.

Thank you to everyone who cast a vote for their favorite artwork in this year’s Congressional Art Competition. Please join us for the awards ceremony tomorrow night where all the submissions will be on display and the winners will be announced. The ceremony begins at 6:30PM at Gallery 1904 located at 1 E. Benton St. in Aurora. Hope to see you there!

I strongly condemn the Republican health care bill that was rammed through the House today. Crafted behind closed doors and voted on before the Congressional Budget Office could even evaluate it – the AHCA would be an unmitigated disaster for hardworking Americans across this country. I urge the people that are going to be hurt by this bill to make their voices known as it makes its way through the Senate.
Thank you to everyone who joined us at North Central College on Saturday to discuss climate change. The strong response of our community should give us optimism that we can tackle it together.
Congratulations to the winners of the 2017 Congressional Art Competition!
I am deeply disturbed by President Trump’s sudden decision to fire FBI Director Comey. Public confidence in our democracy demands the immediate appointment of an independent prosecutor.
Reports that President Trump disclosed highly classified information to Russian officials is just the latest example of his irresponsible behavior that is putting our national security at risk.

63 years ago today, the Supreme Court ruled in Brown v. Board of Education that segregation in public schools was inherently unconstitutional. We honor the legacy of the leaders and communities who made this decision possible and pledge to continue to fight for equality for everyone.

The appointment of a special counsel to investigate connections between President Trump and Russia is a welcome development and strong first step towards getting answers. It does not, however, replace the need for vigorous Congressional investigations to uncover the truth on behalf of the American people.

The brand new SESAME particle accelerator in Jordan is a place where scientists from many countries with diverse backgrounds will come together to pursue knowledge. It’s an example of how science can build bridges of understanding and collaboration throughout the world.

This week, I led a bipartisan letter expressing concern over the dismissal of half of the scientists who make up the Board of Scientific Counselors at the Environmental Protection Agency. Their removal is alarming and threatens the integrity of the EPA’s scientific research programs.

President Trump’s budget request is a clear demonstration of the contempt this Administration has for hard-working families. It reveals empty promise after empty promise. The budget would also surrender America’s position as a leader in science and technology by cutting funding for scientific research. Congress must reject this dangerous budget request.
Join the New Democrats this morning as we hear about the future of work from a series of experts.

Just out - the Republicans' health care plan would leave 23 million Americans without insurance over the next decade. This legislation is an irresponsible affront to hard-working Americans. We need to work together to strengthen the Affordable Care Act and keep health care affordable and accessible.

Today, I reintroduced bipartisan legislation that would provide communities across this country that are struggling to fight the opioid epidemic with vital resources to get treatment to the people who need it.

This Memorial Day weekend was a special one for our community, because I had the distinct honor of presenting Peter Bury with the Bronze Star medal he earned for his service during the Korean War. I am proud to honor the service and sacrifice of the men and women who defend our freedom.

This decision would be a global embarrassment for the United States. We know that climate change is real and largely man made - we must cooperate with the international community to act now so we can preserve the planet for future generations.

President Trump’s decision is a devastating blow to U.S. leadership and a grave threat to the health of our planet. The science is clear: climate change is real and ignoring it will not make it go away.
NA
Joliet Public Library's annual Star Wars Day is one of my favorite events because I get to meet so many great people – this year our community came together to celebrate 40 years of Star Wars!

I led the entire Illinois Democratic congressional delegation in a letter to the Department of Energy to find out the number of jobs at Argonne National Laboratory and Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory that would be eliminated by President Trump’s proposed budget. National labs are not only places of innovation and advanced scientific research, they also employ thousands of people throughout the country and in Illinois.

Last week, I led a letter to the heads of federal science agencies requesting information about how President Trump’s proposed budget would impact jobs. Our country risks huge job losses in science agencies, universities, and labs if the President’s budget is enacted and this would damage America’s leadership in science and innovation.

My thoughts are with Majority Whip Steven Scalise and my colleagues, their staffers, families, and the Capitol Police who work hard to keep Members of Congress safe. This kind of cowardly attack on Members of Congress is horrific. Violence has no place in our government or politics, and I wish everyone who was injured a speedy recovery.

Today marks the 50th anniversary of Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory – a place where scientists from around the world have come together to develop new technologies and move scientific discovery forward.

U.S. Capitol Police are advising the public of a known phone scheme where identity thieves are using Capitol Police Caller IDs to trick people into handing over financial information. The U.S. Capitol Police would never request any form of monetary information or compensation over the phone. If you receive a suspicious call, please call 1-888-CALL-FCC to report the incident to the Federal Communications Commission.

This June, we renew our commitment to the LGBTQ community in the fight for equality and pause to remember the lives we lost in the Pulse night club shooting. No one should face discrimination or violence for their sexual or gender identity.

More troubling news as Scott Pruitt continues to undermine the work of scientists and scientific advisors at the Environmental Protection Agency. Eliminating scientific expertise is short-sighted and dangerous.

The Senate health care plan would only take away health insurance from tens of millions Americans, gut protections for people with pre-existing conditions, and rapidly bankrupt Medicare. Congress should build on the Affordable Care Act, instead of working in secret to deny lifesaving insurance to millions of Americans.

Today, I recognized Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory's 50th anniversary and called on my colleagues in Congress to maintain funding for national labs and science facilities. President Trump's budget threatens the legacy of our national labs and the discoveries scientists make. This is no way to continue our leadership in science and innovation.

Just out - the Congressional Budget Office estimates the Senate health care bill would take away health insurance from 22 million Americans, destroying plans that hard working families, veterans, and seniors need to stay healthy. This plan is unacceptable and a disgrace to millions of American families.

Have you made plans to watch the total eclipse on August 21? You'll need special glasses to actually see it. A number of libraries in the 11th District will hand out these glasses to the public. Click on the link below to find a library near you and mark your calendar for August 21st! (Update: the link is taking a while to load due to increased traffic, so check back later!)

Join me next Thursday evening at a town hall in Joliet to discuss the latest news on health care. We have reached a critical moment in the fight to preserve the progress we made on health care through the Affordable Care Act, so it’s important to hear from everyone in the community. Visit foster.house.gov/aca for all the details and to pre-register to attend.

Today, I reintroduced a resolution calling on the Secretary of Defense to authorize DREAMers to serve in the military. For many of these young people, the United States is the only home they have ever known and they deserve the right to serve their country as patriots.
REMINDER: I’m hosting a town hall tomorrow evening in Joliet to discuss the latest news about health care. Visit foster.house.gov/aca for the details!
Thank you to everyone who came to our town hall last night, including our panelists. It is so important to hear everyone's concerns about the ongoing health care debate.

Join me this Saturday at Alive Center in Naperville for a discussion about issues the LGBTQ community faces in our district and across our country. We need to continue to move our nation forward - to celebrate the diversity that makes us stronger and to protect the right of every individual to live free from discrimination. Visit foster.house.gov/lgbtq for more details and to pre-register to attend.

The work at Edward Hospital & Health Services is a great example of how our community is fighting back against the opioid epidemic – making sure addiction treatment is available to the people who need it.
Great news out in Joliet this week. It’s so inspiring to hear about the great work the Will County community does to serve our veterans – making sure they have a place to call home.

REMINDER: Join me for a community forum tomorrow in Naperville at Alive Center to discuss issues the LGBTQ community face and what we can do to promote equality. Please visit foster.house.gov/lgbtq for the details!
I am pleased the U.S. House rejected this proposal today. It would have the potential to unfairly target Muslim Americans and would make us less safe.
We are LIVE in Naperville this morning for a discussion about #LGBTQ issues and equal rights.

Thank you to everyone who joined us this morning in Naperville for a great discussion about #LGBTQ issues, especially those who shared their personal stories. Our community is stronger when we fight for equality together.
Good news out tonight for all of us who know that the American people deserve access to affordable health care that doesn't exclude anyone based on pre-existing conditions.
It was an honor to meet the Afghan girls' robotics team today. They are an inspiration to young researchers and innovators everywhere.

The latest report from the Congressional Budget Office, the Republican health care plan proposal would take away health insurance from 17 million next year and 27 million by 2020. Premiums would also go up by 25% next year. This kind of legislation has no place in Congress. We should work together to strengthen the Affordable Care Act so that everyone has access to health care.
A great #TBT moment for all of us who believe that scientific research and innovation can lead to great things for our country.

Many thanks to the Architect of the Capitol for a great tour of the changes at the U.S. Capitol's power plant. It's always great to see how new energy sources can make energy production more efficient while reducing greenhouse gas emissions.

President Trump’s proposed ban on transgender individuals serving in the military is a disgustingly bigoted policy that would only make us less safe. I am proud to represent a district that many LGBTQ communities call home. Congress must make sure our service members are welcome to serve regardless of who they love or what gender they identify as.

Join me next Thursday, August 3rd, at West Aurora High School for a community forum to discuss challenges faced by women in today’s society. The event will feature presentations from some of our community’s leading voices on women’s issues who will share their unique insights and experiences and discuss how we can best work together to fight gender discrimination. For all the details and to register to attend please visit foster.house.gov/women.

Last night’s defeat of the Republican attempt to repeal the Affordable Care Act is what happens when you try to pass unpopular legislation behind closed doors. I hope that Republicans will now work together with Democrats to strengthen the Affordable Care Act and stop trying to take health care away from millions of hardworking Americans.

52 years ago today, Medicare and Medicaid were signed into law. These vital programs have helped countless Americans access lifesaving health care. Today, we remember the good they have done and pledge to protect them for future generations.
Thank you to all the participants in this weekend's Super SciTech Saturday. It's always great to see a new generation interested in science.
Reminder: On Thursday in Aurora, I am hosting a community forum on issues women face in today's society. Visit foster.house.gov/women to register to attend!
I’m proud that Will County has become the first solar smart community in Illinois. Now more than ever, it’s vital for local communities to lead on confronting climate change.
We are LIVE in Aurora discussing the challenges women face in our society.
Thank you to everyone who joined us yesterday to talk about the challenges women face in our society. It was a great community discussion.

It is time for the Trump administration to listen to scientists and act now. We know climate change is real and largely man made - how we respond now could have great implications for our planet's future.
On the 72nd anniversary of the bombing of Nagasaki, we are reminded of the destructive power of nuclear weapons and remember that diplomacy must triumph for the world's safety and security.

One week from today, a total solar eclipse will be visible from the United States for the first time since 1979 – and our area will have a great view. Check out this guide for info on local viewing parties.
It's deeply disturbing that President Trump chose to defend white supremacists yesterday instead of rejecting the hatred that seeks to divide us.

Next Wednesday in Joliet, I am hosting a panel discussion on the science of opioid and heroin addiction. This event will focus on the neurological effects these drugs have on developing brains and will feature a discussion about responsible practices for prescribing opioids. For all the details and to register to attend, visit foster.house.gov/heroin.

Our country lost a great physicist and lawmaker this week. In 1993, Dr. Vern Ehlers became the first research physicist elected to Congress where he championed science funding and environmental protections. I was honored to call him my colleague and my friend. Our nation needs more people like Vern Ehlers in public office. My thoughts are with his family during this difficult time.
Today's the day! A total solar eclipse will traverse the United States from Oregon to South Carolina. Can't make it outside today to view it? Check out NASA's live video beginning at 12 EST!
Reminder: Join me tomorrow in Joliet for a discussion on the science of heroin and opioid addiction. For all the details visit foster.house.gov/heroin.
We are LIVE in Joliet this morning discussing the science of heroin and opioid addiction.
Thank you to everyone who joined us yesterday to discuss the science of addiction. I’m proud that the Will County community is a leader in fighting the opioid epidemic.
As we celebrate Women’s Equality Day, let’s honor the accomplishments of the past and continue the fight for equality.
A sobering reminder of the challenges we face as we combat the opioid epidemic and why we will have to work together to end it.

I strongly condemn any attempt to end this program and make DREAMers feel unsafe. The United States is the only home many of these young people have ever known and their presence has made our country stronger. It’s clear that the President fails to appreciate the important contributions these Americans make to our country’s rich diversity and economic prosperity.
Did you enjoy the solar eclipse? If so, check out this calendar so you don't miss another solar system event. Don't miss the meteor showers and Supermoon this fall!

Today, I joined my colleagues in the U.S. House and Senate to call on Congress to #ProtectDreamers. These young people make great contributions our country, and it's time for Congress to protect their future here.

Have questions about the recent DACA decision? Here are some FAQs for recipients. Please share with people you know who may be affected. Do not hesitate to contact my office if you have other questions.

Join us for Service Academy Night Tuesday, September 19th in Bolingbrook. If you are a high school student in the district and are interested in pursuing an education at one of America’s service academies, you will have a chance to learn about  the application process and speak with a representative from one of the institutions. This event is free and parents are encouraged to attend as well. For more details visit foster.house.gov/service. See you there!
Today, we remember the heroism of everyone we lost on September 11, 2001. Their memory will forever live in the hearts and minds of everyone they touched and a country that will never forget.

Join me this Saturday in Aurora for a community discussion on President Trump’s decision to end the DACA program. This is an opportunity for us to come together to discuss the important contributions that DREAMers have made to our community and our country. Please visit foster.house.gov/daca for all the details and to register to attend.

The Trump administration's censorship of scientific inquiry and data has serious consequences for our country's future and safety. We need sustained funding in scientific research and a deep appreciation of the potential science has to improve the lives of all Americans.

I am pleased that the U.S. House unanimously accepted my amendment to provide a better way to understand how technology will change work and the workplace. We need an economy that works for everyone, and this amendment is one of the first steps to plan for the future of work.

Please take a moment to read my op-ed on the opioid crisis and why we need sustained scientific funding to end it. Congress is ready to work together to make sure Americans get the help they need to end opioid dependency.
In honor of Sickle Cell Awareness Month, join us tomorrow morning for a discussion with the NHLBI on the latest sickle cell news. I'm proud to support research as we continue to look for a cure.

Join me Monday evening at Lewis University for an important panel discussion I’m hosting on the future of work. This event will feature presentations from leaders in education, technology, and innovation. Attendees will have an opportunity to participate in the discussion and ask questions. Please visit foster.house.gov/techeconomy for all the info and to register to attend.

Congratulations to NASA - National Aeronautics and Space Administration on a successful mission and to Cassini for its contributions to science. We will miss your beautiful photographs of Saturn and our solar system!
Reminder: Join me tomorrow in Aurora for a community discussion on the importance of protecting DACA.
We are LIVE in Aurora this morning discussing the importance of protecting DACA.

Thank you to everyone who joined us in Aurora on Saturday to discuss the importance of protecting DACA and passing the Dream Act. I am proud to represent a community of individuals who are engaged in such an important issue.
Reminder: Join me tonight at Lewis University for a panel discussion on the future of work & technology.
We’re LIVE at Lewis University discussing the future of work & technology.

The new attempt to repeal the Affordable Care Act in the Senate would raise costs and leave millions of hardworking Americans without health care coverage. We need to work together to improve the Affordable Care Act - not deny Americans access to lifesaving treatment and care.
It was great to visit with employees at Amazon’s fulfillment center in Romeoville yesterday. It just marked its one year anniversary as a member of our community!
My thoughts are with everyone in Puerto Rico who are facing this devastating storm.

Join me next Thursday in Aurora for a Veterans Mental Health & Wellness Fair. It is an opportunity for veterans and their family members to connect with local organizations that promote best practices in mental health and wellness. Please visit foster.house.gov/vetfair for all the details and to register to attend.

Tonight, I joined Democrats to call for a vote on the DREAM Act. DREAMers who are in this country through no fault of their own make great contributions to our country and do not deserve to live in fear of deportation.

Just in - the Congressional Budget Office says that millions would lose health coverage under the #GrahamCassidy proposal. It's time to stop wasting time with empty plans that would hurt Americans and start work on improvements to the Affordable Care Act. Everyone deserves access to affordable health care.
Reminder: Join me tomorrow at Waubonsee Community College in Aurora for a Veterans Mental Health & Wellness Fair.

If this is just another plan to run up the debt by providing new tax breaks for the wealthy, it will be hard to get support from anyone who cares about the future of our country. We need real tax reform that will grow the economy and help working families succeed.

It was great to speak about the Great American Eclipse in today's Science Committee hearing. I had the pleasure of watching the eclipse in Joliet, and it was a perfect moment for everyone to engage in science together.

Reminder: If your #DACA status expires between now and March 5, 2018, you need to submit renewal applications as soon as possible in order to make the October 5, 2017 deadline. Spread the word! https://goo.gl/BDvFSJ
Thank you to everyone who came out yesterday for the veterans' wellness fair. It's so important for our men and women in uniform to get the support they need after they serve our country.
Join us now for a conversation about the history of nuclear weapons and nuclear nonproliferation today.

We are waking up to unimaginable news this morning. We are with you today, Las Vegas. We’ll mourn those we lost too soon and will keep their families and friends close to our hearts. But we cannot accept these tragedies as normal in this country.

I joined my colleagues on the steps of the U.S. Capitol to call for an end to gun violence and mass shootings. It's time for Congress to enact meaningful reforms to end these senseless and horrific events.

I voted against this bill that would limit a woman's right to choose and make health care decisions with her doctor. It is a blatant attack on women's health care - no politician should dictate the decisions women make for their own health.
Today, I asked the former CEO of Equifax why the company did not have more protections in place to protect consumers from massive data breaches.
Great to work with Jim Himes and New Democrat Coalition on the #FutureofWork. It's time Congress understand how technology will change jobs so we can prepare for an economy that works for everyone.

Every individual should be able to live free from discrimination and pursue their dreams regardless of race, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We have made a lot of progress in the last fifty years to make sure all American live free from bigotry and hate. This decision is a clear step in the wrong direction.

Birth control is health care, plain and simple. Women deserve to make health care choices with their doctor with no interference  from employers. This decision will force many women to choose between medication and basic necessities for her and her family.

My staff and I agree on a lot of things - we need stronger gun control, good health care for everyone, and an economy that benefits hardworking Americans. But there's one issue with little consensus this weekend. #FlytheW or #OnePursuit? We'll find out!

Join me next Tuesday in Naperville for an important interfaith community forum to learn more about how our communities can effectively oppose hatred, prejudice, and bigotry. Visit foster.house.gov/interfaith for all the details and to register to attend.
I had great time at this weekend’s Walk to End Alzheimer’s in Joliet. It was inspiring to see so many people turn out to help raise awareness for Alzheimer’s research and treatment.

This order will destabilize our health care system and subject Americans to hollow plans with less coverage. It's time the President work with Congress to strengthen the Affordable Care Act so that we can improve health care for everyone.

This decision is a cruel slap in the face to millions of Americans who depend on these payments for lifesaving care. It is blatantly wrong to punish the American people just because the Republicans who control Congress failed to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act.

The Iran Nuclear Deal has made the world safer thanks to the broad international coalition that made this deal a reality. President Trump’s decision to decertify the deal is irresponsible, threatens the credibility of the United States, and undercuts efforts to prevent the spread of nuclear weapons throughout the world.

Congratulations to all the scientists at Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory, National Science Foundation (NSF), and around the world who worked to make this groundbreaking discovery a reality. These kinds of discoveries help us understand more about our universe and will hopefully send future research into hyper drive.
Thank you to Hermes Elementary School for a wonderful visit this morning!
Reminder: Join me tomorrow night in Naperville for an interfaith community forum to learn more about how our communities can effectively oppose hatred, prejudice, and bigotry.
We are LIVE in Naperville for an interfaith community forum.
Thank you to everyone who came to our interfaith panel last night. We had a very important and productive conversation about what our community can do to prevent hatred and bigotry.
Thanks to everyone who came to the Blackhawk Park dedication yesterday. Fox Valley Park District designed a creative and engaging park that children of all ages will enjoy for a long time.
Thank you to Mechanics Local 701 for a great visit yesterday.
ICYMI: I joined Morning Shift this week to talk about the importance of the Iran Deal and fact based policy in Washington.
It was great to attend STEM Fest at Northern Illinois University this weekend. STEM education and training are the foundations of curiosity that help students of all ages succeed in life.

This budget will inflict hardship on millions of Americans while paving the way for tax breaks for millionaires and billionaires -  tax breaks that history shows will not help grow our economy or create jobs - and $1.5 trillion in debt our children will have to repay. I am committed to working with all my colleagues in the U.S. Congress to simplify our tax code and make commonsense reforms to our budget, but I will not support proposals that benefit the wealthy at the expense of the hardworking citizens of Illinois and all Americans.

I applaud President Trump's decision to recognize the opioid crisis as a public health emergency. But if he is serious about helping individuals who suffer from opioid dependency, he should support sustained funding for scientific research and cease efforts to repeal the Affordable Care Act, which provides treatment options for individuals who need it.
Great to visit Downers Grove South High School this morning!
Congratulations to Argonne National Laboratory on the 10th Anniversary of the Center for Nanoscale Materials – a leading research center for nanotechnology.

My colleagues in Illinois got together today to remind everyone that Open Enrollment starts this Wednesday. It's a great time to review health care plans for you and your family. Go to GetCovered.Illinois.Gov to find out more. #GetCovered
Happy Halloween! In the mood for some scary stories? Check out these science stories for a real life fright.
Open Enrollment has begun! If you purchase your own health insurance, now is the time to shop for your health insurance plan for 2018.

This tax proposal is not a step in the right direction. It will push trillions of dollars of debt onto our children and raise taxes for hardworking families in Illinois. I am committed to working on a bipartisan tax plan that will not increase our debt and benefit middle class families, but this plan would not benefit the majority of hardworking Americans.

Join me next Thursday in Joliet for an important community forum to discuss best practices for protecting personal information from identity thieves. Visit the link below for more details and to register to attend.

Like Orlando and Las Vegas, we will mourn the lives we lost too soon and will pledge support to the injured and their families. But we cannot accept these crimes as normal. Americans deserve to enjoy a night at a concert, time in their houses of worship, and time at a night club without fear of mass gun violence.

Join me this Saturday at Benedictine University for a special Veterans Day Town Hall that will highlight the important work veterans have done for our country as members of our armed services. Please visit foster.house.gov/vetstownhall for all the information and to register to attend.

Today, I called on EPA Administrator Pruitt to rescind his directive to remove scientists from the EPA’s science advisory boards. This decision is a blatant attempt to undermine the scientific expertise at the EPA – an agency that plays a vital role in the protection of our country’s environment and public health.
Reminder: Join me tomorrow evening for a consumer identity protection forum to discuss best practices for protecting personal information in an increasingly digital world.

Today, I proudly introduced the bipartisan GI Education Benefits Fairness Act with Congressman Mark Takano and Congresswoman Cathy McMorris Rodgers – legislation to make sure our service members and their families receive the full education benefits they are promised.
We are LIVE in Joliet discussing identity theft and best practices for protecting personal data.
We are LIVE in Joliet discussing identity theft and best practices for protecting personal data.
Happy Veterans Day! Our men and women in uniform have risked their lives to protect and serve our country at home and abroad. Today, we recognize and honor their service and sacrifice.
We are LIVE for a special Veterans Day Town Hall
Thank you to everyone who honored Veterans Day this weekend. It is a privilege to listen to our men and women who served this country.

The Iran Nuclear Deal gave us an unprecedented opportunity to access Iranian nuclear sites. As a result of the agreement, we have the diplomatic and scientific framework to monitor any action the Iranians may take to build a nuclear weapon - a framework we would not have without this deal and that is working.
I’m proud to announce that Joliet Junior College will receive nearly $650,000 from the National Science Foundation to support programs that will enhance STEM education for students.

This morning, I spoke on the House Science, Space, and Technology Committee on a bill that would authorize funding for three important projects: Argonne National Laboratory's Advanced Proton Source, Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory's Long-Base Neutrino Facility, and the Spallation Neutron Source upgrade. Scientific investment has made the United States a leader in innovation and technology. These projects will continue to advance our understanding of science and technology.
Thank you to everyone who continues to fight for women’s health care. No one should come between a woman and her decisions for her own health.

I voted against the Republican tax plan because it will raise taxes for middle class families in Illinois, slash Medicare funding, and add trillions to our national debt – all so that the wealthiest Americans get a tax break.
NA

I oppose any attempt to blatantly restrict access to content on the Internet. I believe broadband consumers should have access to all lawful content on the Internet and that all lawful applications should be usable on networks. Network management that is anti-competitive or otherwise harmful to the free exchange of information is wrong and will do little to spur innovation and the free exchange of ideas.

I opposed the Republicans' tax plan because of the damage it would do to hardworking families. More studies have shown that this legislation would increasingly harm hardworking families even as wealthy families benefit. This is not the kind of tax plan we need to grow the economy and help the people who need it the most.

Join me this Saturday at the Illinois Mathematics and Science Academy (IMSA) Official Site for an interactive STEM Connect event. This event will feature exhibits from local organizations that provide educational programs focused on science, technology, engineering, and mathematics. Young people can explore these subjects in a fun, interactive way. This is a free event and open to everyone, but registration is required. Visit foster.house.gov/STEMconnect to sign up.
On World AIDS Day, let’s celebrate the advances in medicine and education that are slowing the spread of HIV and recommit to the work that lies ahead to end this epidemic.

Today, I was proud to introduce a resolution with Congressman Mark Takano to establish National 3D Printing Day. 3D printing technology provides businesses and entrepreneurs in Illinois and across the country with state-of-the-art tools to compete in the world economy and is bringing innovation to communities everywhere.
We are LIVE in Aurora to discuss open enrollment for health care coverage. Tune in for information on how you can get covered.

ICYMI: Please take a moment read the op-ed I co-authored with Mike Quigley and Congressman Brad Schneider on the effects of the Republican tax plan on Illinois. It is past time for Congress to work on real tax reform that provides relief to hardworking American families.

The United States is a leader in science and innovation due to the technical expertise of scientists and individuals with science backgrounds who help the next generation of researchers thrive in labs, universities, and federal agencies. This report has deeply troubling implications for our country's reputation as a leader in problem solving and technological advancement. We need people who are actually qualified for the jobs they hold to maintain our country's progress in science and innovation.

I voted against the continuing resolution because it does nothing to address the long list of priorities to resolve - the DREAM Act, stabilizing health care marketplaces, and guaranteed funding for millions of children’s health care.

ICYMI: Check out this story about Ted Petry who is the last surviving witness of the first atom split in Chicago. It's a reminder of both the incredible experiments that led to the development of nuclear weapons and the progress we've made with the international community to monitor their development worldwide.

Don’t forget! This Friday is the deadline to sign up for 2018 health insurance plans through the Illinois health care marketplace. If you need health care coverage or want compare your options, visit foster.house.gov/openenrollment for more information on how to get covered!

Today marks the two-year anniversary of the historic Paris Agreement – an accord that brought the world’s nations together to reduce carbon emissions and fight climate change. President Trump has chosen to ignore science and abdicate America’s leadership on this issue, but the American people have not. We are #StillIn.

It's been five years since the tragic shooting at Sandy Hook. In that time there’s been more than 1,700 mass shootings in our country and over 170,000 gun deaths. We cannot accept this and need to do more than hold moments of silence after each tragedy. Let’s honor the victims with action and finally pass commonsense gun safety laws.

Need health insurance? Time is running out.Today is the last chance to sign up for 2018 coverage on HealthCare.gov. Don’t miss your chance for affordable coverage. Due to financial help, 8 in 10 people can find plans for less than $75 a month. Log on to HealthCare.gov or call 1-800-318-2596 for help in finding the right plan for you and get covered!

Recently, more than 300 students took part in Naperville North High School's FIRST Lego League tournament – a program designed to inspire young people's interest in science and technology. Great programs like this expand opportunities for STEM education.

I voted against the Republican Tax Plan because it’s a massive gift to large corporations and wealthy campaign donors – paid for with more than $1 trillion in new debt that our children must repay in the future.

Today, I called for the retraction of any order that bans the use of particular words or phrases by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention in budget requests. The work that comes out of the CDC is too important for our country’s public health to censor the budget requests for critical public and global health programs.
